001package imagingbook.common.util;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
004import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
007import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
008import java.lang.reflect.Field;
009import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.Base64;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
016
017/**
018 * Defines static methods for making a shallow copy of any object.
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2022/09/11
022 */
023public abstract class ObjectUtils {
024        
025        private ObjectUtils() {
026        }
027        
028        // https://stackoverflow.com/a/26000025
029        
030        /**
031         * Returns a shallow copy of the given object using reflection.
032         * This can be used if the {@link Cloneable} interface is not 
033         * (or cannot be) implemented.
034         * 
035         * @param <T> generic type
036         * @param entity the object to be copied
037         * @return the object copy
038         */
039        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
040        public static <T> T copy(T entity) {
041            Class<?> clazz = entity.getClass();
042//          T newEntity = (T) entity.getClass().newInstance();
043            T newEntity = null;
044                try {
045                        newEntity = (T) entity.getClass().getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
046                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException
047                                | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) { }
048
049            while (clazz != null) {
050                copyFields(entity, newEntity, clazz);
051                clazz = clazz.getSuperclass();
052            }
053
054            return newEntity;
055        }
056
057        private static <T> T copyFields(T entity, T newEntity, Class<?> clazz) {
058            List<Field> fields = new ArrayList<>();
059            for (Field field : clazz.getDeclaredFields()) {
060                fields.add(field);
061            }
062            for (Field field : fields) {
063                field.setAccessible(true);
064                try {
065                                field.set(newEntity, field.get(entity));
066                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
067            }
068            return newEntity;
069        }
070        
071        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
072        
073                // adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/30968827
074                private static byte[] convertToBytes(Object object) {
075                        ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
076                    try (ObjectOutputStream out = new ObjectOutputStream(bos)) {
077                        out.writeObject(object);
078                        return bos.toByteArray();
079                    } catch (IOException e) { }
080                    return null;
081                }
082                
083                private static Object convertFromBytes(byte[] bytes) {
084                        ByteArrayInputStream bis = new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes);
085                    try (ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(bis)) {
086                        return in.readObject();
087                    } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) { }
088                    return null;
089                }
090                
091                
092                // TODO: check for null/exceptions
093                /**
094                 * Serializes and encodes an arbitrary object to a string. This is potentially
095                 * dangerous and only intended for local use, e.g., to define constant matrices
096                 * with full precision. The string encoding is 'Base64' implemented with
097                 * standard Java8 functionality. See {@link #decodeFromString(String)} for
098                 * decoding.
099                 * 
100                 * @param object an arbitrary object
101                 * @return the Base64 string encoding of the object
102                 */
103                public static String encodeToString(Object object) {
104                        byte[] ba = convertToBytes(object);
105                        return Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(ba);
106                }
107                
108                // TODO: check for null/exceptions
109                /**
110                 * Decodes and deserializes an object encoded with {@link #encodeToString(Object)}.
111                 * The type of the encoded object must be known.
112                 * 
113                 * @param string the encoded object string
114                 * @return the associated object (cast to the known type)
115                 */
116                public static Object decodeFromString(String string) {
117                        byte[] ba = Base64.getDecoder().decode(string);
118                        return convertFromBytes(ba);
119                }
120
121                // -------------------------------------------
122                
123                public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
124                        PrintPrecision.set(16);
125                        double[][] M1 =
126                                {{3.240479, -1.537150, -0.498535},
127                                 {-0.969256, 1.875992, 0.041556},
128                                 {0.055648, -0.204043, 1.057311}};
129                        
130                        String encoded = encodeToString(M1);
131                        double[][] M2 = (double[][]) decodeFromString(encoded);
132                        
133                        System.out.println("M1 (orig) = \n" + Matrix.toString(M1));
134                        System.out.println("M2 (decoded) = \n" + Matrix.toString(M2));
135                        
136                        double[][] M12 = Matrix.add(M1, Matrix.multiply(-1, M2));
137                        System.out.println("M1 - M2 = \n" + Matrix.toString(M12));
138                }
139}
